  • y2 (array-like) – Array of y-values.

  • e2_thresh (float) – The threshold value of y to interpolate for.

Returns:

The interpolated x-values corresponding to the e2_thresh.

src.utils.data_processing.read_and_transform_data(h5_file_path, gt_num, lidar_mat_file)[source]¶

Read ground truth data from an HDF5 file and transform the coordinates from latitude/longitude to UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator).

Parameters:

  • h5_file_path (str) – Path to the HDF5 file containing ground truth data.

  • gt_num (str) – Ground truth dataset identifier (group name in the HDF5 file).

  • lidar_mat_file (str) – Path to the MAT-file containing lidar data for UTM correction.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • pd.DataFrame: Corrected ground truth data with UTM coordinates and altitude.

  • pd.DataFrame: Original ground truth data with uncorrected UTM coordinates.

  • list: UTM corrections [easting correction, northing correction, vertical correction].

Return type:

tuple

src.utils.plotting.plot_figures(ccr_data_index, ccr_truth_data, gt_data_corrected, utm_correction, results, output_dir, plot_data_list)[source]¶

Plots multiple figures to visualize and analyze the data, including ground truth, CCR data, and error analysis.

Parameters:

  • ccr_data_index (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing CCR data including ground truth, ccrNum, and related fields.

  • ccr_truth_data (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing CCR truth data such as coordinates and labels.

  • gt_data_corrected (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing corrected ground track data (e.g., UTM coordinates and altitude).

  • utm_correction (tuple) – Tuple of UTM corrections (dx, dy, dz) to apply to CCR data.

  • results (numpy.ndarray) – Results array with estimated footprint diameters and associated error metrics.

  • output_dir (str) – Directory to save the generated plots.

  • plot_data_list (dict) – Dictionary containing plot data for individual CCR returns and other information for histogram plotting.

src.utils.plotting.plot_selection_data(gt_data_corrected, gt_data, ccr_truth_data, region_name)[source]¶

Plot various data related to ground truth, CCR data, and selection regions.

Parameters:

  • ccr_truth_data (pandas.DataFrame) – Data of CCR truth points.

  • region_name (str) – The region name (e.g., ‘WSMR’) for plotting limits and labels.

Returns:

Matplotlib figure, axis, and scatter plot object.
